content: next st double_crochet in next st* repeat between * across ending with slip_stitch in last chain of turning chain turn pattern row 5 repeat row 4 twelve times or until cowl measures ~10 cm/ 4 inches decreases the width is decreased by two stitches on either end of each row i have included an abbreviated stitch chart of this section below 6 ch1 skip first stitch single_crochet in next st pattern stitch across until last 4 stitches ending with single_crochet and slip_stitch in next two stitches leave last 2 stitches unworked turn 7 ch1 skip first stitch slip_stitch in next st pattern stitch across until 2 stitches are left ending with slip_stitch in next stitch skip last slip_stitch turn 8 repeat row 7 until only 2 stitches are left fasten_off mary thomson designs on ravelry 12nd may 2012 bottom edging 9 attach yarn at bottom edge of cowl at narrowest point ch2 double_crochet in first stitch and in each stitch around ending with slip_stitch in last stitch turn 10 ch2 bpdc around first stitch and around each stitch along ending with slip_stitch into last chain of turning chain turn 11 ch2 fpdc around first stitch and around each stitch along ending with slip_stitch into last chain of turning chain turn fasten_off and weave in ends making sure to connect ends of foundation chain whilst doing so make give wear and enjoy
